get.docs:
This [action](https://esphome.io/automations/actions.html#config-action) sends a GET request.

*See also: [`http_request.get` Action](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-get-action)*

post.docs:
This [action](https://esphome.io/automations/actions.html#config-action) sends a POST request.

*See also: [`http_request.post` Action](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-post-action)*

body.docs:
**, string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/automations/templates.html#config-templatable)**: A HTTP body string to send with request.

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-post-action)*

json.docs:
**, mapping**: A HTTP body in JSON format. Values are [templatable](https://esphome.io/automations/templates.html#config-templatable). See [Examples](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-examples).

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-post-action)*

method.docs:
**, string**: HTTP method to use (`GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE`, `PATCH`).

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-send-action)*

buffer_size_rx.docs:
**, integer**: Change HTTP receive buffer size. Defaults to `512`.

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#configuration-variables)*

buffer_size_tx.docs:
**, integer**: Change HTTP transmit buffer size. Defaults to `512`.

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#configuration-variables)*

esp8266_disable_ssl_support.docs:
**, boolean**: Determines whether to include HTTPS/SSL support in the firmware binary. Excluding the SSL libraries from your build will result in a smaller binary, which may be necessary for memory-constrained devices (512 kB or 1 MB). If you see `Error: ESP does not have enough space to store OTA file` in your device’s logs, you may need to enable this option. Defaults to `false`. By setting this option to `true`:
  * HTTPS connections will not be possible
  
  * `verify_ssl: false` is implied
  
  

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#configuration-variables)*

follow_redirects.docs:
**, boolean**: Enable following HTTP redirects. Defaults to `true`.

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#configuration-variables)*

id.docs:
**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#configuration-variables)*

redirect_limit.docs:
**, integer**: Maximum amount of redirects to follow when enabled. Defaults to `3`.

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#configuration-variables)*

timeout.docs:
**, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: Timeout for request. Defaults to `4.5s`.

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#configuration-variables)*

useragent.docs:
**, string**: User-Agent header for requests. Defaults to `ESPHome/<version> (https://esphome.io)` where `<version>` is the version of ESPHome the device is running. For example: `ESPHome/2024.6.0 (https://esphome.io)`

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#configuration-variables)*

verify_ssl.docs:
**, boolean**: When set to `true` (default), SSL/TLS certificates will be validated upon connection; if invalid, the connection will be aborted. To accomplish this, ESP-IDF’s default ESP x509 certificate bundle is included in the build. This certificate bundle includes the complete list of root certificates from Mozilla’s NSS root certificate store. **May only be set to true when using the ESP-IDF framework; must be explicitly set to false when using the Arduino framework.**

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#configuration-variables)*

watchdog_timeout.docs:
**, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: Change the watchdog timeout during connection/data transfer. May be useful on slow connections or connections with high latency. **Do not change this value unless you are experiencing device reboots due to watchdog timeouts;** doing so may prevent the device from rebooting due to a legitimate problem. **Only available on ESP32 and RP2040**.

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#configuration-variables)*

url.docs:
**, string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/automations/templates.html#config-templatable)**: URL to which to send the request.

*See also: [HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/http_request.html#http-request-get-action)*

flash.docs:
This action triggers the download and installation of the updated firmware from the configured URL. As it’s an ESPHome [action](https://esphome.io/automations/actions.html#config-action), it may be used in any ESPHome [automation(s)](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation).

*See also: [`ota.http_request.flash` Action](https://esphome.io/components/ota/http_request.html#ota-http-request-flash-action)*

md5.docs:
**, string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/automations/templates.html#config-templatable)**: The [MD5sum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Md5sum) of the firmware file pointed to by `url` (below). May not be used with `md5_url` (below); must be specified if `md5_url` is not.

*See also: [OTA Update via HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/ota/http_request.html#id2)*

md5_url.docs:
**, string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/automations/templates.html#config-templatable)**: The URL of the file containing an [MD5sum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Md5sum) of the firmware file pointed to by `url` (below). May not be used with `md5` (above); must be specified if `md5` is not.

*See also: [OTA Update via HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/ota/http_request.html#id2)*

password.docs:
**, string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/automations/templates.html#config-templatable)**: The password to use for HTTP basic authentication.

*See also: [OTA Update via HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/ota/http_request.html#id2)*

url.docs:
**, string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/automations/templates.html#config-templatable)**: The URL of the binary file containing the (new) firmware to be installed.

*See also: [OTA Update via HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/ota/http_request.html#id2)*

username.docs:
**, string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/automations/templates.html#config-templatable)**: The username to use for HTTP basic authentication.

*See also: [OTA Update via HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/ota/http_request.html#id2)*

source.docs:
**, string**: The URL of the YAML manifest file containing the firmware metadata.

*See also: [Managed Updates via HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/update/http_request.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.docs:
**, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval at which to check for (**not install**) updates. Defaults to 6 hours.

*See also: [Managed Updates via HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/update/http_request.html#configuration-variables)*
